test_cases.query: How many EIA energy records are in the dataset?
test_cases.ground_truth: The dataset contains 211 EIA (Energy Information Administration) energy production and consumption records.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests if embeddings can identify and count specific entity types

test_cases.query: List all types of LAS well log curves available
test_cases.ground_truth: The dataset includes 27 different LAS curve types including density (DLDN, DLDPL), porosity (ACAPL), gamma ray (GST, GR), uranium (GSUR), and resistivity measurements.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests entity type discrimination and attribute extraction

test_cases.query: What USGS water monitoring sites are included?
test_cases.ground_truth: The dataset includes USGS site 03339000: VERMILION RIVER NEAR DANVILLE, IL.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests specific entity retrieval accuracy

test_cases.query: What information is available about subsurface geological formations?
test_cases.ground_truth: Subsurface geological information is available through well log data from Kansas Geological Survey, including formation properties measured via density, porosity, and gamma ray logs.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests semantic understanding of domain concepts beyond exact keyword matches

test_cases.query: Show me surface water quality data
test_cases.ground_truth: Surface water quality data is available from USGS monitoring site on the Vermilion River near Danville, IL.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests if embeddings understand 'surface water' relates to rivers/USGS not wells

test_cases.query: What reservoir rock properties can I find?
test_cases.ground_truth: Reservoir rock properties available include porosity (from density and neutron porosity logs), bulk density measurements, and gamma ray signatures indicating lithology.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests domain-specific semantic mapping (reservoir properties → porosity/density)

test_cases.query: How many different types of well log measurements are recorded?
test_cases.ground_truth: There are 27 different types of well log curve measurements recorded in the dataset.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests ability to aggregate counts across multiple curve entities

test_cases.query: What different unit types are used across all measurements?
test_cases.ground_truth: Measurement units include GM/CC (grams per cubic centimeter), API (American Petroleum Institute units), PERCNT (percentage), PPM (parts per million), and others.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests retrieval completeness across heterogeneous entities

test_cases.query: What are all the different data sources in this dataset?
test_cases.ground_truth: Data sources include: EIA (Energy Information Administration) for energy production data, USGS (United States Geological Survey) for water monitoring, and Kansas Geological Survey (KGS) for well logs.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests cross-entity-type aggregation and source identification

test_cases.query: What is the most recent data update timestamp in the well logs?
test_cases.ground_truth: The most recent well log update was on 03/04/1999 at 21:59 by the Kansas Geological Survey.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests temporal extraction and chronological ordering

test_cases.query: What date range does the well log data cover?
test_cases.ground_truth: Well log data updates span from 02/24/1999 to 03/04/1999.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests date range extraction across multiple records

test_cases.query: What data is specifically from Kansas?
test_cases.ground_truth: Kansas data includes well log files from the Kansas Geological Survey (KGS) with measurements from wells in Kansas including section 30S39W and EIA energy production records.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests geographic entity recognition and location-based filtering

test_cases.query: Find data from well section 30S39W
test_cases.ground_truth: Section 30S39W contains well 1001178549 (Collingwood well) operated by the Kansas Geological Survey.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests specific location identifier retrieval

test_cases.query: What measurements are from Illinois?
test_cases.ground_truth: Illinois data includes USGS site 03339000 on the Vermilion River near Danville, IL with water quality measurements.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests cross-state geographic filtering

test_cases.query: How is bulk density measured in these well logs?
test_cases.ground_truth: Bulk density is measured using the DLDN curve (curve 12) with units in GM/CC (grams per cubic centimeter).
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests technical accuracy and method explanation

test_cases.query: What types of porosity measurements are available?
test_cases.ground_truth: Porosity measurements include density porosity (DLDPL for limestone basis - curve 8) and acoustic porosity (ACAPL - curve 18) measured in percent.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests discrimination between related technical concepts

test_cases.query: What does the gamma ray log measure?
test_cases.ground_truth: Gamma ray logs (GST curve) measure natural radioactivity in formations, with uranium content (GSUR) measured in PPM, used to identify lithology and clay content.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests explanation quality for technical concepts

test_cases.query: Compare the different porosity measurement methods
test_cases.ground_truth: Density porosity (DLDPL) uses bulk density measurements on a limestone basis, while acoustic porosity (ACAPL) uses acoustic wave travel time. Both are measured in percent but use different physical principles.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests comparative analysis across related entities

test_cases.query: How do well log curves differ from USGS measurements?
test_cases.ground_truth: Well log curves measure subsurface geological properties (porosity, density, resistivity) from boreholes, while USGS measurements track surface water quality and flow in rivers and streams.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests ability to contrast fundamentally different data types

test_cases.query: What is the source organization for the well log data?
test_cases.ground_truth: Well log data is sourced from the Kansas Geological Survey (KGS).
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests metadata/provenance retrieval

test_cases.query: What files are associated with well 1001178549?
test_cases.ground_truth: Well 1001178549 has an additions file (1001178549.add) and an input LAS file (/home/crude2_3/WellLogs/Guy/100-Amoco/disc09/18720743.las.las).
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests file-level metadata retrieval

test_cases.query: Which company operated the wells in this dataset?
test_cases.ground_truth: The dataset contains references to Amoco in the file path (/100-Amoco/), suggesting Amoco was involved in well operations, though explicit operator fields would need to be confirmed in the detailed well metadata.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests entity extraction from file paths and metadata

test_cases.query: What curves are recorded for the Collingwood well?
test_cases.ground_truth: This query requires graph relationships between well documents and curve entities to answer accurately. Current single-hop retrieval may not connect these.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Exposes need for well→curve relationships in graph

test_cases.query: What measurements are associated with USGS site 03339000?
test_cases.ground_truth: This query requires site→measurement relationships. Current architecture may not traverse these connections.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Exposes need for site→measurement edges

test_cases.query: What wells are in the same geographic area as the Vermilion River?
test_cases.ground_truth: This requires spatial relationships or geographic indexing to connect USGS sites with nearby wells.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests geographic relationship needs

test_cases.query: What is the weather forecast for Kansas?
test_cases.ground_truth: The dataset does not contain weather forecast information.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests out-of-scope query handling

test_cases.query: Show me COVID-19 case counts for Illinois
test_cases.ground_truth: The dataset does not contain COVID-19 or public health data.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests rejection of completely unrelated queries

test_cases.query: What are current oil and gas stock prices?
test_cases.ground_truth: The dataset does not contain financial market or stock price data.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests handling of tangentially related but out-of-scope queries

test_cases.query: Find all density measurements from Kansas wells updated in March 1999
test_cases.ground_truth: This requires combining temporal, spatial, and attribute filters. The Collingwood well (1001178549) in Kansas was updated 03/04/1999 and contains density measurements (DLDN, DLDPL).
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests handling of queries with multiple filter dimensions

test_cases.query: Compare subsurface porosity with surface water quality indicators
test_cases.ground_truth: This requires retrieving and contrasting different data domains: porosity from well logs (subsurface) and water quality from USGS (surface). These are fundamentally different measurement types from different environments.
test_cases.diagnostic_value: Tests ability to reason across heterogeneous data types

metadata.description: Expanded evaluation dataset for comprehensive GraphRAG system optimization
